Song.title: Have Thine Own Way
Song.copyright: Words by Ad­e­laide Poll­ard Music by George Steb­bins Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [D]Have Thine own [G/D]way, [D]Lord! Have Thine own [A7]way! [A7]Thou art the [A6]Pot[A]ter, I am the [D]clay. [D]Mold me and [G/D]make [D]me [D7]after Thy [G]will, [G]While I am [D/A]waiting, [A7]yielded and [D]still.
Verse 2: [D]Have Thine own [G/D]way, [D]Lord! Have Thine own [A7]way! [A7]Search me and [A6]try [A]me, Master, to[D]day! [D]Whiter than [G/D]snow, [D]Lord,{,} [D7]wash me just [G]now, [G]As in Thy [D/A]presence [A7]humbly I [D]bow.
Verse 3: [D]Have Thine own [G/D]way, [D]Lord! Have Thine own [A7]way! [A7]Wounded and [A6]wea[A]ry, help me, I [D]pray! [D]Power, all [G/D]pow[D]er, [D7]surely is [G]Thine! [G]Touch me and [D/A]heal me, [A7]Savior di[D]vine.
Verse 4: [D]Have Thine own [G/D]way, [D]Lord! Have Thine own [A7]way! [A7]Hold o’er my [A6]be[A]ing absolute [D]sway! [D]Fill with Thy [G/D]Spir[D]it [D7]’till all shall [G]see [G]Christ only, [D/A]always, [A7]living in [D]me.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 have thine own way lord have thine own way thou art the potter i am the clay mold me and make me after thy will while i am waiting yielded and still verse 2 have thine own way lord have thine own way search me and try me master today whiter than snow lord wash me just now as in thy presence humbly i bow verse 3 have thine own way lord have thine own way wounded and weary help me i pray power all power surely is thine touch me and heal me savior divine verse 4 have thine own way lord have thine own way hold oer my being absolute sway fill with thy spirit till all shall see christ only always living in me
